newsitem.title: USA: Biosys says files under Chapter 11.
newsitem.headline: Biosys says files under Chapter 11.

text.p: Biosys Inc said on Monday it has filed for reorganization under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code, because it had been unable to alleviate a chronic cash shortage.
The biological products developer said in a statement that it could not raise the financing necessary to cover losses from poor operating and market conditions.
Biosys also said it expected its shares to be delisted from Nasdaq, because it was unable to meet certain exchange requirements.

It said it could not meet Nasdaq's $4 million net tangible assets requirement or the exchange's minimun bid price test. The company, which filed for reorganization last Friday, said it would operate as a debtor-in-possession and intended to formulate a plan or reorganization or liquidation. Creditors would be receiving notice of the filing from the court, it said.
It previously had said that cool and wet weather had depressed its revenues during the second quarter in key market segments and severely reduced available cash resources.
